ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: If you had a choice between individual therapy and medication to help prevent trauma related symptoms (e.g., nightmares, upsetting thoughts, fear) which would you choose?
How strong is your treatment preference?
Notes: 1=I don't care; 2=I somewhat care; 3=I strongly prefer what I chose

ElementDescription: Please rate on the following scale how confident you feel this would be your choice?
Regardless of what you picked- How much would the number of the therapy treatment sessions matter (1 or 3 sessions)?
Notes: 1=It would not matter; 2=It would somewhat matter; 3=It would strongly matter

ElementDescription: Regardless of what you picked- How much would you be willing to spend an hour while in the hospital to prevent symptoms if it were recommended by a care provider?
Regardless of what you picked- How much would an injection into your IV vs. an oral pill matter?
Notes: 1=It would not matter; 2=It would somewhat matter; 3=It would strongly matter

ElementDescription: Regardless of what you picked- Would you want there to be treatment to prevent these symptoms?
Have you ever been in therapy for a mental health concern before?
Did this subject ever take medication for emotional or behavioral problems?
If you went for treatment, how helpful do you think therapy would be for you?
To what extent do you think that therapy would help you learn effective ways to cope with symptoms?
If you or a close friend or family member was in in a similar situation, would you recommend they receive therapy intended to prevent PTSD?
If you went for treatment, how helpful do you think medication would be for you?
To what extent do you think that medication would help you learn effective ways to cope with symptoms?
If a close friend or family member was in in a similar situation, would you recommend they receive a medication intended to prevent PTSD?
Overall, what is your current attitude toward seeking treatment from a mental health professional were you to develop mental health symptoms from your recent experience?
If I were to develop mental health symptoms from my recent experience, I would want to seek in treatment from a mental health professional.
If I were to develop mental health symptoms from my recent experience, I would actively seek treatment from a mental health professional.
Time Point
